intro: Senecio melastomifolius subsp. melastomifolius, commonly known as the Melastomifolius groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers arranged in a cluster. Its botanical structure is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
